etymology.description: 魚(魚) (yú, "fish") with simplification 灬(灬) (biāo, "fire") → 一(一) (yī, "one")
etymology.interpretation: The traditional character 魚(魚) (yú, "fish") represents a stylized depiction of a fish. In the simplified form 鱼, the four-dot component 灬(灬) (biāo, "fire") at the bottom of the character was replaced with the simpler stroke 一(一) (yī, "one"), which is easier to write.
etymology.simplification: The simplification of 魚(魚) (yú, "fish") to 鱼 involves using 一(一) (yī, "one") as a cursive shorthand for the more complex 灬(灬) (biāo, "fire") component at the bottom of the traditional character.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢吃鱼(我喜歡吃魚)。
河里有许多鱼(河裡有許多魚)，它们自由自在地游来游去(它們自由自在地遊來遊去)。
examples.pinyin: Hé lǐ yǒu xǔduō yú, tāmen zìyóu zìzài de yóu lái yóu qù.
examples.english: There are many fish in the river, and they swim around freely.

examples.chinese: 渔民每天出海捕鱼(漁民每天出海捕魚)，以维持生计(以維持生計)。
examples.pinyin: Yúmín měitiān chūhǎi bǔ yú, yǐ wéichí shēngjì.
examples.english: Fishermen go out to sea every day to catch fish in order to make a living.
